column1: Cut Nyak Dien Airport (Indonesia: Bandar Udara Cut Nyak Dhien) (IATA: MEQ
column2: ICAO: WITC) is an airport located in Nagan Raya Regency
column4: Indonesia. Location the airport is located 26 kilometers from Suka Makmue
column7: and 347 kilometers from the city of Banda Aceh. The airport serves both Suka Makmue the capital Nagan Raya Regency and Meulaboh the capital of West Aceh Regency. The airport is named after Cut Nyak Dhien
column8: the woman who led the Acehnese guerrilla forces during the Aceh War against the Dutch for 25 years
column9: and was awarded the title of National Hero of Indonesia in 1964. With the inauguration of the well equipped and modern terminal on 2008
column10: the Airport now able to provided better and comfortable environment for its passengers. Cut Nyak Dhien Airport is a small airport
column11: however it is the biggest airfield in the west coast of Aceh province. The Airport has 2 helipads measuring 72 m x 26 m. The operation of the Airport is managed by PT Angkasa Pura. Flight Destinations There are commercial schedule flights from Cut Nyak Dhien Airport to destinations as below: Airline Name Destination Garuda Indonesia (by Explore) Medan Susi Air Banda Aceh
column12: Medan Wings Air Medan Public Transportation Taxi and private car services: Various taxi and private car services are provided by numerous service providers outside the arrival hall. Car Park: There are plenty of vehicle parking space within walk distance outside the terminal. Technical Specification The airport resides at an elevation of 1 metres (3 ft) above mean sea level. It has one runway designated 15/33 with an asphalt surface measuring 2
